dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, can a government actually, you know, just end financial "cannibalism" by setting a fixed interest rate? Really?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, can a government actually, you know, just end financial cannibalism by setting a fixed interest rate? Really?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, um, when it's about boosting GDP to seven percent by 2025, you kinda have to. It's an investment, eight trillion tenge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, um, when it's about boosting G D P to seven percent by twenty twenty five, you kinda have to. It's an investment, eight trillion tenge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In order to achieve the government's goal of increasing GDP to 7 percent by 2025, the holding plans to allocate about 8 trillion tenge to support entrepreneurship, develop housing construction, and implement key national and investment projects...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Eight trillion, sure, but "cannibalism"? And "rate arbitrage"? That just sounds like, uh, normal market competition to me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Eight trillion, sure, but cannibalism? And rate arbitrage? That just sounds like, uh, normal market competition to me.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, it's about a fair rate, 12.6 percent, for entrepreneurs. It's to stop distorting the market, not, like, encourage it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, it's about a fair rate, twelve point six percent, for entrepreneurs. It's to stop distorting the market, not, like, encourage it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He emphasized that business stimulation will be carried out by setting a uniform interest rate of 12.6 percent for end borrowers. "The main goal of this initiative is to offer enterprises in the real sector a fair rate without distorting the financing market...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fair for whom? And who decides what's "fair" when the market's supposed to decide? This just smells like, um, market interference.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fair for whom? And who decides what's fair when the market's supposed to decide? This just smells like, um, market interference.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's reducing the burden on the state budget, Host_A! Moving away from subsidies. That's a good thing, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's reducing the burden on the state budget, Host_A! Moving away from subsidies. That's a good thing, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...reducing the burden on the state budget while gradually moving away from the practice of subsidization," Karagoyshin said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But they need a trillion tenge annually to recapitalize. Where's that coming from? And what about the big businesses getting a credit guarantee fund? Is that fair?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they need a trillion tenge annually to recapitalize. Where's that coming from? And what about the big businesses getting a credit guarantee fund? Is that fair?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To achieve these goals, the holding requires capitalization of 1 trillion tenge annually," Karagoyshin stated. ... Earlier, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Economy Serik Zhumangarin announced that Kazakhstan will create a new credit guarantee fund for large businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's all part of the plan to add 1.3 percent to GDP growth. You can't just pick one part and, like, ignore the bigger picture.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's all part of the plan to add one point three percent to G D P growth. You can't just pick one part and, like, ignore the bigger picture.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to him, supporting the economy with 8 trillion tenge in 2025 will provide an additional 1.3 percent boost to the country's GDP growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The "bigger picture" seems to be the government, uh, trying to micromanage everything. This won't work long-term.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The bigger picture seems to be the government, uh, trying to micromanage everything. This won't work long-term.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It will work. It's targeting real sector enterprises. It's about stability, not, um, letting everyone just do whatever they want.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It will work. It's targeting real sector enterprises. It's about stability, not, um, letting everyone just do whatever they want.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "The main goal of this initiative is to offer enterprises in the real sector a fair rate without distorting the financing market..."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Stability, or, like, stifling innovation? This uniform rate, it just seems so, like, artificial.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Stability, or, like, stifling innovation? This uniform rate, it just seems so, like, artificial.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's necessary to meet the goals, to support housing, entrepreneurship. You can't just let the market, uh, run wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's necessary to meet the goals, to support housing, entrepreneurship. You can't just let the market, uh, run wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the holding plans to allocate about 8 trillion tenge to support entrepreneurship, develop housing construction, and implement key national and investment projects...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Running wild is often where real growth comes from, not, you know, central planning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Running wild is often where real growth comes from, not, you know, central planning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Central planning is what saves it when the "wild" market gets, um, predatory. This is a smart move.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Central planning is what saves it when the wild market gets, um, predatory. This is a smart move.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Smart for some, maybe. But I'm just not seeing it. It feels like a bandage on a bullet wound.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Smart for some, maybe. But I'm just not seeing it. It feels like a bandage on a bullet wound.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's a fundamental restructuring. It's going to make a difference. A huge difference.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a fundamental restructuring. It's going to make a difference. A huge difference.
